page.title: 02Tree Planting Ceremony
page.content: On October 24th 1985 at 2.45 we planted a tree,donated by Fairfield Nurseries because we took part in a drawing competition and quiz.It was an elm tree,to help replace those which were killed by Dutch Elm disease a few years back.The tree was approximately three metres tall.Henry Deeds and Richard Priestly wrote an invitation asking Mr Chrichton-Miller to plant the tree. The youngest child in the school ,Louise Carter ,was chosen to take handfuls of compost and put it around the roots.She will be able to watch it grow for the longest time.All the classes gathered around to watch while this was happening.Then we put a strong stick into the ground and tied the tree to it with fabric because string would have cut into the young trunk.
